title: FTSE LIVE: Crucial day for Brexit; Whitbread hit by 'difficult' UK trading
text:
European markets had a good session on Monday as the prospect of a no-deal Brexit receded into the distance, with the German DAX closing at its best levels in over a year.

The pound is flat on Tuesday morning as the currency shrugs off concerns that Johnson's Brexit deal could yet be derailed as the Prime Minister attempts to force through the 110-page bill in just three days.

In company news, Premier Inn owner Whitbread - which sold off Costa Coffee last year - has posted lower half-year profits as it said it was weighed down by 'difficult' UK trading conditions.

And the energy watchdog, Ofgem, has revealed new rules to ensure fast-growing gas and electricity providers can properly serve their customers.
